<!DOCTYPE>: declaration represents the document type, and helps browsers to display web pages correctly.
<!DOCTYPE html>: All HTML documents must start with a document type declaration.
<html></html>: The HTML document itself begins with <html> and ends with </html>.
<head></head>: element is a container for metadata. HTML metadata is data about the HTML document. Metadata is not displayed.
<body></body>: The visible part of the HTML document is between <body> and </body>.
<h1>to<h6>: <h1> defines the most important heading. <h6> defines the least important heading.
<p></p>:
HTML paragraphs are defined with the

tag.
<a></a>: HTML links are defined with the <a> tag.
<img>: HTML images are defined with the tag. The source file (src), alternative text (alt), width, and height are provided as attributes.
